newsitem.title: USA: Two injured when Continental Airlines jet misses gate.
newsitem.headline: Two injured when Continental Airlines jet misses gate.

text.p: A Continental Airlines 727 jet being moved from a maintenance area to a gate at Newark Airport overshot the jetway and crashed into a terminal building, injuring two people, an airport spokesman said.
The two employees who were in the cockpit of the jet were taken to a hospital for treatment, he said.
"The nose of the plane became lodged in the USAir terminal that Continental was using Saturday," the spokesman said. "There was a lot of structural damage to the jet."
There were no passengers on the jet, he said.
The jet was being moved to another gate for a flight later in the day when the accident occurred.
